thread.title: Taiwan's HTC Swings to Net Loss
thread.title_full: Taiwan's HTC Swings to Net Loss

author: morningstar.com
title: Taiwan's HTC Swings to Net Loss
text:
HTC Corp. said Monday it swung to a net loss in the third quarter as it continued to struggle in the competitive smartphone market.
Taiwan-based HTC said its net loss for the three months ended Sept. 30 was NT$4.48 billion (US$138 million) compared with a net profit of NT$0.6 billion a year earlier. Its revenue also dropped sharply to NT$21.4 billion from NT$41.9 billion in the same period last year.
The downbeat results came as no surprise as HTC has issued a profit warning and announced a series of restructuring efforts including job cuts in response to sluggish demand and weak sales in China.
Once the world's top smartphone maker by volume, HTC in 2013 fell out of the top 10 largest handset vendors by shipments. The Taiwanese company's global market share has dropped to less than 2% in the past few years from double digits previously.
Write to Lorraine Luk at lorraine.luk@wsj.com
Subscribe to WSJ: http://online.wsj.com?mod=djnwires
October 05, 2015 07:45 ET (11:45
